data.title: OpenGL vsync fixes.
data.body: Enables setting vsync for OpenGL without needing to re-start the app.

data.title: GuiContentProfile is not defined
data.body:
Hey guys,

Just a minor thing I stumbled upon while debugging C#, this profile: GuiContentProfile doesn't seem to be defined anywhere, but it's referred to in the scripts about 14 places. Like in art/gui/CameraGui.gui
Should it be replaced with another profile? Or just fall back to GuiDefaultProfile as it does now?

data.title: colorPicker/swatch srgb display.
data.body:
dependency from @rextimmy: tolinear and togamma for color+lumnance.
partly addresses https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1870
full followup (cleanup and consistency) pending 4.0

data.title: Fixes window icons with SDL
data.body:
Fixes window icons with SDL, hooking it through the var $Core::windowIcon as the path.

Also adjusted the splash window icon to use the var $Core::splashWindowImage for it's path.

In reference to #1746

data.title: Default port fix
data.body:
Resolves two things:

- Incorrect default port used for clients
- Incorrect multicast address print

data.title: Fixes Bullet not supporting holes in terrain.
data.body: Fix from @Lopuska 's PhysicsGMKRefactor branch!

data.title: readme update
data.body: badges =)

data.title: After resaving EditorGui.gui for example, engine crashes on startup
data.body:
development & master branch, 32bit windows, DirectX9, no SDL, build.

Reproduce with this:
1. Open GUI Editor
2. Open EditorGui.gui
3. Save as.. overwrite the existing file
4. Close editor
5. Open editor (here crash should occur)
6. Open EditorGui.gui (here 100% crash will occur)

data.title: Improve default flags for cmake
data.body:
When you generate a new project with cmake the default settings could be improved by activating:
TORQUE_D3D11
TORQUE_OPENGL
TORQUE_SDL
by default as well, since most people will want to have those features in the game, otherwise the default settings cmake generates are pretty  good already and with those settings additionally there would be almost no need to adjust the flags anymore, except for special needs like dedicated builds etc.

data.title: Shadow casting spot light flickering
data.body:
After updating my project to 3.10 ( and 3.9 ) I noticed that my night level where I had spotlights that cast shadows no longer work properly, they were flickering all the time and most of the time one or all of them were not working properly, here is a video showing it:
http://duion.com/files/temp/3.10-spotlight_flicker_bug.mp4

After I tested with a stock T3D release build I noticed the issue was not there, so I tried out different options.
I loaded the stock T3D engine into my project and the problem was still there.
Later I found out that this was caused by the sun/moon casting shadows, so when I disabled moon shadows it worked fine as before.
Then I tested stock T3D with sun/moon shadow and with spotlights and it still works, so the flaw had to be in my game.
Later I found out that it was the postFX setting SSAO that caused this, which was not enabled by default in stock T3D, so when I disabled SSAO it worked without flickering and with sun/moon light in my game project as well.
So any ideas why a level with SSAO + (Spotlight+castShadows) + (sun+castShadows) causes this?

data.title: Canvas picked color does not match on some rgb values
data.body:
Hi, I have noticed this when changing Canvas color values. When using basic color rbg combination like magenta it matches ok..

**#ff00ff**
![canvas2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/21267214/618fbc1c-c3e4-11e6-91c0-da9973932f34.png)

but when tested on some gradient combination particularly gray here, the result is a much lighter color and completely off:

**#202020**
![canvas1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/21267218/646e5dee-c3e4-11e6-9e8b-f3b708f10efd.png)

data.title: Fog brightens up water too much
data.body:
In 3.10 (maybe 3.9) I noticed that the fog brightens up the water too much, black fog results in black water, but as soon as you slightly brighten the fog, the water brightens much more and unproportionally.
Black fog, black water:
http://duion.com/files/temp/shadowwater_black.jpg
Dark grey fog, almost white water:
http://duion.com/files/temp/shadowwater_bright.jpg

It worked properly before ( 3.8 )

data.title: GuiObjectView graphic glitches
data.body:
I use a GuiObject view, that renders the soldier with a changeable skin, as a skin changer preview window, but it flickers almost all the time and has various graphical glitches such as a diagonal line through the image that blocks the image, sometimes it flickers, sometimes it is white and sometimes it is affected by the fog and lighting settings of the current or last level.
Here is how it looks broken:
http://duion.com/files/temp/brokenskinpreview.jpg
It shows the diagonal line and the white
And here it is how it should look like:
http://duion.com/files/temp/brokenskinpreview_normal.jpg
It changes a lot between those states so you have to be lucky to have it working, but the glitches happen a lot.

data.title: Extreme lag spikes in OpenGL when zooming
data.body:
In 3.10 when I have OpenGL on and press zoom I get extreme FPS drop like to 10 FPS from 60 FPS.
This only happens sometimes.
I think it happens when you are in a level and change the shader quality levels (parallax/normal mapping) while in game, then you will get the lags, but not when you first join a level.
This is the console error that comes when that happens:

GFXGLShader::init - Error linking shader!
Program shadergen:/d552ece632483f1a_V.glsl / shadergen:/d552ece632483f1a_P.glsl: Vertex shader(s) failed to link, fragment shader(s) failed to link.
Vertex link error: INVALID_OPERATION.
ERROR: error(#275) Symbol "_TEXCOORD2_" is defined with 2 different types between two stages
WARNING: warning(#276) Symbol "_TEXCOORD5_" usage doesn't match between two stages
WARNING: warning(#276) Symbol "_TEXCOORD6_" usage doesn't match between two stages
WARNING: warning(#276) Symbol "_TEXCOORD3_" usage doesn't match between two stages
fragment link error: INVALID_OPERATION.
ERROR: error(#275) Symbol "_TEXCOORD2_" is defined with 2 different types between two stages
WARNING: warning(#276) Symbol "_TEXCOORD5_" usage doesn't match between two stages
WARNING: warning(#276) Symbol "_TEXCOORD6_" usage doesn't match between two stages
WARNING: warning(#276) Symbol "_TEXCOORD3_" usage doesn't match between two stages

TerrainCellMaterial::init - Failed to create pass!

And after that:

GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.
GFXCardProfiler (OpenGL) - Unknown capability 'GL::Workaround::noCompressedNPoTTextures'.

But I already posted that here:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1863
 it also happens at the beginning of loading a level.

data.title: Nav mesh in editor does not stay hidden
data.body:
When you have a nav mesh object in your mission simgroup and you hide it, it will hide, but when you exit the editor and open the editor again it is no longer hidden but visible, even thought it is still marked as hidden. Same is when you hide it and quit the game and then re open the level in editor, it will be visible again.
This is only for the nav mesh, all other objects work fine with hiding etc I think.

data.title: Small terrain texture banding issue with basic lighting
data.body:
Since 3.10 there is a slight banding effect when using basic lighting and no HDR:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_DesertRuins_day_003-0001.png
Not such a serious issue, since the banding is not that strong and only appears in basic lighting wihtout HDR, but maybe someone knows what it is.

data.title: OpenGL level preview image loading problems
data.body:
This is more related to my game, since I have a preview image in the loading screen from the level, but when I switch to OpenGL render mode, it sometimes does not load or flickers:
http://duion.com/files/temp/brokenloadingscreen.jpg
It is a GuiBitmapCtrl.
And it is set through a script function:
LOAD_MapPic.setBitmap( "levels/load_mission.jpg" );
It only sometimes does not load, for example when first starting the mission.
This issue seems to be there since version 3.10

data.title: Navmesh flickering in editor in OpenGL
data.body:
In 3.10 when you open a level with a navmesh in the editor it has graphic glitches:
http://duion.com/files/temp/navmeshglitches.jpg
This may be related:
https://gist.github.com/Duion/4467b8db6b3c32bc4ef04d5fee1d2b8d

But try it yourself to confirm it, you just need a navmesh in the level and render mode OpenGL

data.title: Multiple canvas support for GL and DX11
data.body: Add support for multiple canvas for GL & DX11. Do note there is a problem with SDL and multiple windows but that is a separate case. All 3 gfx work perfectly with win32 platform code.

data.title: flips dx11, opengl, and sdl2 on by default now that those are no long…
data.body: …er experimental. also seperates out the dedicated flag for compilation on windows

data.title: Add Filter for dyamic objects when building a navmesh in the editor
data.body:
Makes it so dynamic objects don't contribute to the navmesh when building in the editor. This avoids player objects, vehicles, etc from blocking parts of the navMesh.

When in-game and tiles are rebuilt, it keeps the contribution of dynamic objects so AI can path around other players, etc.

data.title: uts bitangent direction determinant back
data.body: went overzealous on the bitangent cleanup when reviewing parallax. the W multiplier can and should stay. the y flip can remain gone.

data.title: Updated recast to 1.5.1
data.body: updated recast from 1.4.9 (2009) to v1.5.1 (2016)

data.title: fix SDL text events from generating a ~ key when opening the console
data.body: Fixes a bug with SDL where the ~ would be applied to the console text entry responder. could apply to other first responders as well.
